Description: Busts of Heraclius and Heraclius Constantine, diademed, draped and cuirassed, facing, cross between. (obverse)
State: Associated with: Byzantine Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Byzantine Empire
Cultures/periods: Umayyad dynasty (Part of early Umayyad coin hoard)
Curator's comments: W. E. Crum and H. I. Bell, Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts from the excavations undertaken by the Byzantine Research Account Copenhagen 1922), 9.
Bibliographic references: MIB3 / Moneta Imperii Byzantini (vol.3 von Heraclius bis Leo III) (203, p.231)
BZ1 / Catalogue of the Imperial Byzantine Coins in the British Museum, vol. 1 (287) (type)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Heraclius I
